categoryRubrics.rule: Generally, the identifiers found within a CDA document should be unique and non-reoccurring within the same document.
EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveDate/Times for historical events should be greater than the patient's date of birth and less than the earliest of current time or patient's date of death.

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

issuesList.xmlString: <value xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="160604004" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" displayName="Moderate cigarette smoker, 10-19/day" xsi:type="CD"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Smoking status code value should be valid
Smoking status observation Template Id should be valid
Systems should capture birth sex independent of the Administrative Gender and encode them as an observation in the Social History Section.

issuesList.xmlString:
SOCIAL HISTORY
Social History Observation Description Dates Observed
Current Smoking Status Former smoker September 10, 2012
Tobacco Use Moderate cigarette smoker, 10-19/day February, 2009 - February, 2011
Alcoholic drinks per day 12 Since February, 2012

categoryRubrics.description: Systems should capture birth sex independent of the Administrative Gender and encode them as an observation in the Social History Section.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Time elements have the right time and timezone offsets
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveTime elements in the section are expected to have timeoffsets along with the date and are typically nonzero timeoffsets. In addition they are expected to have the timezone information for proper interpretation.For e.g if the time is being defaulted to 000000 for hours, minutes and seconds for multiple entries it might be worth checking if the data was entered properly. Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveDate/Times for historical events should be greater than the patient's date of birth and less than the earliest of current time or patient's date of death.

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology

categoryRubrics.description: Lab Results should use the top 2000 LOINC codes and their corresponding units as a best practice.

categoryRubrics.rule: Lab results should be expressed with LOINC codes
categoryRubrics.description: Lab results should be expressed with LOINC codes

categoryRubrics.rule: The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Result Organizer must encompass the underlying observations.
categoryRubrics.description: The EffectiveDate/Time elements of the Results Organizer cannot be out of sync with the Result Observation. Each of the Observation's EffectiveTime/low >= Organizer's EffectiveTime/low and Observation's EffectiveTime/high should be <= Organizer's EffectiveTime/high

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: The Vital Sign Observation entries should use LOINC codes to represent the type of vital sign being captured

issuesList.xmlString: <code xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="3141" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.1" codeSystemName="LOINC" displayName="Patient Body Weight - Measured"/>

categoryRubrics.description: Each of the vital sign observation present in the document should use the recommended LOINC codes to represent the vital sign.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each of the Vital Sign Observations should use the recommended UCUM units to represent the vital sign measurement result
categoryRubrics.description: The recommended UCUM units should be used to represent the Vital Sign result values as part of the observation.

categoryRubrics.rule: The EffectiveDate/Time elements for the Vital Sign Organizer must encompass the underlying observations.
categoryRubrics.description: The EffectiveDate/Time elements of the Vital Signs Organizer cannot be out of sync with the Vital Signs Observation. Each of the Observation's EffectiveTime/low >= Organizer's EffectiveTime/low and Observation's EffectiveTime/high should be <= Organizer's EffectiveTime/high

Also if the time offsets are present without a timezone, the time may be interpreted incorrectly, hence timezones should be specified as part of the time element.

categoryRubrics.rule: EffectiveDate/Times for all historical activities should be within the lifespan on the patient.
categoryRubrics.description: EffectiveDate/Times for historical events should be greater than the patient's date of birth and less than the earliest of current time or patient's date of death.

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: All problem codes are should express with core subset of SNOMED codes
Problem Concern effective times reflect the appropriate problem concern status.
categoryRubrics.description: A Problem Concern of completed or suspended should have a Problem Concern effectiveTime/high value present.Similarly a Problem Concern which is Active shall not have a Problem Concern effectiveTime/high value.

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.description: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text

categoryRubrics.rule: All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
categoryRubrics.description: All Template Ids should be present with valid extension value

categoryRubrics.rule: The Display Names used by the structured data should match the Display Name (Preferred Name) within the Terminology
categoryRubrics.description: Each of the code systems, value sets specified by the C-CDA IG refers back to standard terminologies like SNOMED-CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD9, ICD10. When codes from these codesystems are used to represent structured data the display name corresponding to the code should be used as part of the document

categoryRubrics.rule: Each entry has to be linked to related narrative text
All Template Ids should be Valid with correct extension value
Patient DOB should be valid and properly precisioned
Patient's Alternative Name Rule

referenceErrors.description: Consol Continuity of Care Document (CCD) (V3) SHALL contain  [1..1] component such that it  (CONF:1198-30665, CONF:1198-30666) Conforms to Problem Section (V3) (entries required) (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.5.1:2015-08-01)

Consol Continuity of Care Document (CCD) (V3) SHALL contain  [1..1] component such that it  (CONF:1198-30669, CONF:1198-30670) Conforms to Results Section (entries required) (V3) (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.3.1:2015-08-01)

Consol Continuity of Care Document (CCD) (V3) SHALL contain  [1..1] component such that it  (CONF:1198-30687, CONF:1198-30688) Conforms to Social History Section (V3) (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.17:2015-08-01)

Consol Continuity of Care Document (CCD) (V3) SHALL contain  [1..1] component such that it  (CONF:1198-30689, CONF:1198-30690) Conforms to Vital Signs Section (entries required) (V3) (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.2.4.1:2015-08-01)

Consol Encounters Section (entries required) (V3) If section/@nullFlavor is not present, SHALL contain  [1..*] entry such that it  (CONF:1198-8709, CONF:1198-15468) Conforms to Encounter Activity (V3) (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.49:2015-08-01)
